title: Isis Holding Horus
description:
Dark green stone statuette of Isis, seated nursing the child Horus. Vulture headdress, right hand holds left breast. Plinth bears column of incised hieroglyphs. Dedicated by p3-nhsy (?) son of nit-ikr.
Condition: Top of headdress and plinth missing. Headdress may have been made separately judging by socket on top of head. Face of Horus damaged.
inscribed: Single column of inscription on back pillar continues down back of seat.
credit_line: Gift of Evangeline Wilbour Blashfield, Theodora Wilbour, and Victor Wilbour honoring the wishes of their mother, Charlotte Beebe Wilbour, as a memorial to their father, Charles Edwin Wilbour
section: The Third Intermediate Period and the Beginning of the Late Peri
